enhanced_by.reason: Starting an object in the FlatBufferBuilder is typically required before adding fields like x and y.
Preparing the buffer with the correct size is necessary before putting the float values.
Both methods return an offset value, which can be used to assert the correct position in the buffer.
The x() method retrieves the x value from the buffer, which can be used to assert the correctness of the createPointFloat_ method.
The y() method retrieves the y value from the buffer, which can be used to assert the correctness of the createPointFloat_ method.
